feedback:
Excellent application of the DRIVER framework throughout your work. You clearly demonstrated 6 stages: D, R, I, V, E, R2.


STRENGTHS:
- Financial APP: The student built and executed a working Python tool that generates financial snapshots and full investment memos for companies (Implement evidence), chosen to address a specific problem (Discover) and validated results against real data (Reflect). These show the tool functions as a financial application, meeting the pass criterion.
- Integrate AI: The submission shows AI is central to the tool (interactive memo generation) and was iteratively improved and validated against real data, demonstrating effective, value-adding integration. Although implementation details are light, the DRIVER stages provide sufficient conceptual and practical evidence to meet PASS under the moderate standard.

criteria.criterion_name: Financial APP: The tool functions as a financial application.
evidence: ["what I made today was um basically you call it a calculator that you give it the financials of a you really don't even have to give it anything. you just ask like um what it ask what company you want to know and then it gives you a full investment memo on everything you need to know on that company and it's interactive too"]
["So, I figured using a Python script would be better because it's more consistent and I know I can get a natural result that I want instead of just talking AI for 10 hours with no result."]
["So first gives you a quick snapshot with the re what their revenue um net income debt all this other stuff while it's drafting the memo."]
criteria.driver_alignment: Discover (identified need and chose Python approach), Implement (ran the script and demonstrated output), Reflect (validated outputs against real data and noted usefulness).
criteria.reasoning: The student built and executed a working Python tool that generates financial snapshots and full investment memos for companies (Implement evidence), chosen to address a specific problem (Discover) and validated results against real data (Reflect). These show the tool functions as a financial application, meeting the pass criterion.

criteria.criterion_name: Integrate AI: The tool integrates AI capabilities effectively.
evidence: "what I made today was um basically you call it a calculator that you give it the financials of a you really don't even have to give it anything. you just ask like ... what company you want to know and then it gives you a full investment memo on everything you need to know on that company and it's interactive too"
"I didn't want to use NHN because I had a lot of trouble in the past using it ... So, I figured using a Python script would be better because it's more consistent"
"To validate it, I basically just looked up if Nike, like when I did it earlier with Starbucks, I looked up the Starbucks numbers were actually correct and they were."
criteria.driver_alignment: Discover: identified problem with existing AI tooling and set goal to build a Python-based solution. Implement: ran the script and demonstrated generated memos (execution). Reflect: validated outputs against real company data and iterated (added risk section).
criteria.reasoning: The submission shows AI is central to the tool (interactive memo generation) and was iteratively improved and validated against real data, demonstrating effective, value-adding integration. Although implementation details are light, the DRIVER stages provide sufficient conceptual and practical evidence to meet PASS under the moderate standard.
